title: Test regeneration cycle with rerere
description: Make a change in ruby-bindgen (or simulate upstream change), regenerate on generated branch, merge to main. Verify rerere auto-resolves conflicts and manual changes are preserved.

title: Predicate methods with default params should use ? suffix
description: bool isContinuous(int i = -1) generates is_continuous instead of continuous?. The predicate naming logic in namer.rb checks args_size == 0, but methods with all-default parameters should also be treated as predicates since they're callable without arguments.
close_reason: Fixed predicate naming: methods with is prefix now get ? suffix regardless of params

title: Use cursor.argument(i) instead of find_by_kind in arguments method
description: arguments() calls find_by_kind(false, :cursor_parm_decl) which iterates ALL cursor children. Use cursor.num_arguments and cursor.argument(i) for direct O(1) lookup instead. Eliminates 595 of 1946 find_by_kind calls (30%).

title: Implement generated branch merge workflow
description: Implement git branch workflow for preserving manual changes across binding regeneration. Uses a 'generated' branch with pure output, merged to main where manual changes live. Rerere remembers conflict resolutions.

title: Update tests for increment_post/decrement_post naming
description:
After fixing the operator naming, update test expected files:

1. Run tests to find failures
2. Update `test/bindings/cpp/*.cpp` expected files
3. Verify all tests pass

Depends on the naming fix being applied first.

title: Support array member fields via Rice buffers
description:
## Problem

Array member fields like `int idx[MAX_DIM]` in `cv::SparseMat::Node` are not wrapped. The field is silently skipped.

## Root Cause

In `lib/ruby-bindgen/visitors/rice/rice.rb:1347-1354`:

```ruby
def visit_field_decl(cursor)
  return unless cursor.public?

  # Can't return arrays in C++
  return if cursor.type.is_a?(::FFI::Clang::Types::Array)

  self.render_cursor(cursor, "field_decl")
end
```

All array-type fields are skipped entirely.

## Solution

Array fields should be wrapped using Rice's buffer mechanism, similar to how pointer parameters use `ArgBuffer`/`ReturnBuffer`. The `field_decl.erb` template needs to handle array types specially, generating something like:

```cpp
define_attr("idx", &cv::SparseMat::Node::idx, Rice::AttrAccess::Read)
```

Rice already supports buffer handling per `docs/features.md` - this extends that support to member fields.

## Affected Files

- `lib/ruby-bindgen/visitors/rice/rice.rb` - remove/modify array skip logic
- `lib/ruby-bindgen/visitors/rice/field_decl.erb` - handle array type output

## Test Case

Add a class with an array member field to `test/headers/cpp/classes.hpp` and verify it generates correct bindings.
close_reason: Fixed array field wrapping - removed skip logic, made arrays read-only

title: Document predicate method naming convention
description: Update docs/features.md to document the predicate method naming rules: (1) bool return with zero params gets ? suffix, (2) bool return with is[A-Z] or is_ prefix gets ? suffix regardless of params. Related to ruby-bindgen-1xq.

title: Set up rerere and generated branch in opencv-ruby
description: Enable git rerere, create 'generated' branch, regenerate bindings fresh to establish pure baseline. First step to prove the workflow works.

title: Replace global $1 regex variables with named captures
description:
Several places use global $1/$2 variables after regex matches:

- Lines 1929, 1955 in `resolve_base_instantiation`
- Line 668 in `qualify_dependent_types_in_template_args`

These are fragile - if code changes between match and use of $1, wrong data is captured.

Replace with named captures or inline `match[1]` access.

title: Analyze profile call graph for additional optimizations
description:
Profile file: /mnt/c/Source/ruby-bindgen/bin/profile_graph.txt (1.6MB)

HOW TO READ THE PROFILE:
- Each method has a section bordered by dashed lines (---)
- Lines ABOVE the method = CALLERS (who called this method)
- Lines BELOW the method = CALLEES (what this method called)  
- Format: time  self%  total  self  wait  child  calls  method
- Notation like '595/1946' means '595 of 1946 total calls came from this caller'

KEY METHODS TO INVESTIGATE:
1. find_by_kind (8.36s, 1946 calls) - already have fix for arguments (595 calls)
2. overloads (7.98s, 44 calls) - recursive, walks inheritance hierarchy
3. render_class_templates (11.32s) - calls find_by_kind once but takes 3s
4. find_default_value (3.16s, 847 calls) - may have optimization opportunities
5. visit_children (12.21s, 60 calls) - called twice per class by two_pass

SEARCH COMMANDS:
- grep -n 'find_by_kind' profile_graph.txt | head -50
- Look for sections with high time and trace callers/callees
- Focus on methods with high per-call cost (total_time / calls)

ALREADY IDENTIFIED:
- ruby-bindgen-25e: arguments() should use cursor.argument(i)
- ruby-bindgen-cfv: eliminate two-pass visiting with group_by

title: skip_symbols should filter template class builders
description:
`cv::MatCommaInitializer_` is in `skip_symbols`, but the generator still creates `MatCommaInitializer__builder`.

The skip_symbols filter should prevent template class builders from being generated for skipped symbols.
close_reason: Fixed: skip_symbols now filters template class builders

title: Update increment/decrement naming in mat-rb.cpp manually
description:
After reverting mat-rb.cpp, apply these renames manually:

**Naming change:**
- `increment_pre` → `increment`
- `increment` → `increment_post`
- `decrement_pre` → `decrement`
- `decrement` → `decrement_post`

**Affected classes (in template builders):**
- `cv::MatConstIterator_<_Tp>` - increment, increment_post, decrement, decrement_post
- `cv::MatIterator_<_Tp>` - increment, increment_post, decrement, decrement_post
- `cv::SparseMatConstIterator_<_Tp>` - increment, increment_post
- `cv::SparseMatIterator_<_Tp>` - increment, increment_post

**Affected classes (non-template):**
- `cv::MatConstIterator` - increment, increment_post, decrement, decrement_post
- `cv::SparseMatConstIterator` - increment, increment_post, decrement, decrement_post
- `cv::SparseMatIterator` - increment, increment_post
- `cv::NAryMatIterator` - increment, increment_post

Use find/replace:
1. `"increment_pre"` → `"increment"`
2. `"increment"` → `"increment_post"` (careful: do after step 1)
3. `"decrement_pre"` → `"decrement"`
4. `"decrement"` → `"decrement_post"` (careful: do after step 3)
close_reason: Applied naming changes: increment/decrement for pre, increment_post/decrement_post for post

title: Eliminate two-pass child visiting - use group_by instead
description: visit_children_two_pass calls visit_children twice (once for non-static, once for static). Instead: visit all children once, use group_by to split into static/non-static buckets, then process each. Eliminates duplicate traversal and redundant overloads computation.

title: Make ITERATOR_METHODS configurable
description:
The iterator method names are hardcoded at line 1058:

```ruby
ITERATOR_METHODS = ["begin", "end", "cbegin", "cend", "rbegin", "rend", "crbegin", "crend"].freeze
```

Should be configurable via bindings.yaml for:
- Custom iterator method names
- Excluding specific iterator methods

title: Add recursion depth limits
description:
Recursive methods have no maximum depth limit:

- `copyable_class?` (line 1154) - traverses inheritance chain
- `auto_generate_base_class` (line 1600) - recursive base generation

Deep or circular inheritance could cause stack overflow.

Add a max depth parameter with sensible default (e.g., 50).

title: Support relative paths in bindings.yaml
description: Resolve input/output paths relative to the bindings.yaml file location, not the current working directory. Allows portable configs that work regardless of where repo is cloned.

title: Add array field define_attr to mat-rb.cpp manually
close_reason: Added 3 array field attrs: MatStep::buf, SparseMat::Hdr::size, SparseMat::Node::idx

title: Refactor bindings.yaml compiler config structure
description: Combine libclang and clang_args into unified structure with clang-cl: and clang: top-level keys, each containing libclang and args.

title: Fix cruby_name collision between global and namespaced types
description:
Global C types and namespaced C++ types can produce the same cruby_name variable:
- `CvVideoWriter` (global C type) -> `rb_cCvVideoWriter`
- `cv::VideoWriter` (namespaced C++ class) -> `rb_cCvVideoWriter`

**Proposed fix**: Insert underscore between namespace prefix and class name for namespaced types:
- `CvVideoWriter` (global) -> `rb_cCvVideoWriter`
- `cv::VideoWriter` (namespaced) -> `rb_cCv_VideoWriter`
- `cv::cuda::Stream` -> `rb_cCv_Cuda_Stream`

**Current workaround**: Manually rename the legacy C type variable to `rb_cCvVideoWriterLegacy` in videoio-rb.cpp after regeneration.

title: Support cross-file overload detection
description:
Functions like `cv::error` and `cv::randu` have overloads spread across different header files (e.g., `error` in both `base.hpp` and `core.hpp`).

The current overload detection only finds overloads within a single namespace cursor, missing cross-file overloads.

**Current workaround**: Add these functions to `skip_symbols` in bindings config if they cause compilation errors like "could not deduce template argument for 'Function_T'".

This is a known limitation that would require tracking overloads across translation units.

title: Update Rice operators.md documentation
description:
Update `/mnt/c/Source/rice/docs/bindings/operators.md`:

1. **Fix increment/decrement table (lines 79-84):**
   - Change `++a` mapping from `increment_pre` to `increment`
   - Change `a++` mapping from `increment` to `increment_post`
   - Change `--a` mapping from `decrement_pre` to `decrement`
   - Change `a--` mapping from `decrement` to `decrement_post`

2. **Fix logical operators bug (line 73):**
   - `!` is incorrectly listed as mapping to `decrement_pre`
   - Should just be `!` (Ruby supports overriding it)

New table:
```
| ++a  | Not overridable  | increment      |
| a++  | Not overridable  | increment_post |
| --a  | Not overridable  | decrement      |
| a--  | Not overridable  | decrement_post |
```

title: Fix bare rescue clauses in rice.rb
description:
Several bare rescue clauses swallow all exceptions, masking real errors:

1. Line 415-422 `has_export_macro?` - catches all exceptions, returns true
2. Lines 925, 981 `find_default_value` - catches ArgumentError but may swallow others

Should catch specific exception types or at minimum log/warn on unexpected errors.

title: Performance optimization for binding generation
description: Optimize ruby-bindgen performance. Profile shows mat.hpp takes ~29s. Key hotspots: find_by_kind (8.36s, 1946 calls), visit_children_two_pass (8.84s), overloads (7.98s). Target: significant reduction in generation time.

title: Check opencv-ruby bindings for missing array field attrs
description:
After the array field fix in ruby-bindgen, regenerated files may have new define_attr calls for array fields that need to be manually added to files with manual edits.

**What to check:**
Scan all `*-rb.cpp` files in `/mnt/c/Source/opencv-ruby/ext/opencv2/` for classes that might have array member fields that are now supported.

**How to identify:**
1. Regenerate bindings for each module
2. Compare with existing file
3. Look for new `define_attr` lines with `Rice::AttrAccess::Read` (array fields are read-only)

**Already fixed:**
- `core/mat-rb.cpp`: MatStep::buf, SparseMat::Hdr::size, SparseMat::Node::idx
close_reason: Not needed - regenerating bindings will automatically include any missing array attrs

title: Add null safety checks in rice.rb
description:
Several places access properties without null checks:

1. Line 1504 `visit_template_specialization` - `type_ref.definition` called without checking if type_ref is nil
2. Line 1572 `auto_generate_base_class` - unsafe array indexing with `&.[](1)`
3. Lines 168-169 `visit_translation_unit` - unconditional pop after conditional shift

These could cause NoMethodError crashes on certain inputs.

title: Fix asymmetric increment/decrement operator naming
description:
The increment/decrement operator naming is confusing:

Current:
- Pre (`++a`): `increment_pre`
- Post (`a++`): `increment`

Should be (pre-increment is the common case, gets simple name):
- Pre (`++a`): `increment`
- Post (`a++`): `increment_post`

**File:** `lib/ruby-bindgen/namer.rb:34-35`

```ruby
'++' => ->(cursor) { cursor.type.args_size == 0 ? 'increment' : 'increment_post' },
'--' => ->(cursor) { cursor.type.args_size == 0 ? 'decrement' : 'decrement_post' },
```
